name: pineapple peacock shawl
notes:
**finished measurements**
width: 56”
depth: 28”

**materials**
universal yarn major (100% acrylic; 200g/328 yds)
•	111 jewel – 2 balls
hook: us size k-10½ (6.5 mm) or size needed to obtain gauge
notions: tapestry needle

**gauge**
rows 1-4 = 4” high
save time, check your gauge.

**pattern notes**
this half-circle shawl is worked from the center out. a picot border is added around the entire outer edge of the shawl at the end.

raveler jonnamartinez made three awesome videos on how to crochet this shawl:

**part one** 
https://youtu.be/l6v4etie8dg

**part two** 
https://youtu.be/rsxhghj8gw0

**part three** 
https://youtu.be/vmq0py8bkmq

errata: 

row 26 should read:

row 26: sl st to center of double cl, beg cl in same sp, ch 2, cl in same sp, {ch 8, [sc in next ch-5 sp, ch 5] 2 times, sc in next ch-5 sp, ch 8, double cl in next double cl, ch 5, sc in next ch-6 sp, **ch 5**, double cl in next double cl} to last group of sc + ch-5 sps, {ch 8, [sc in next ch-5 sp, ch 5] 2 times, sc in next ch-5 sp, ch 8, double cl in next double cl, turn – 14 double cl, 21 sc.

also at [knit and crochet now][1]


  [1]: https://www.anniescatalog.com/knitandcrochetnow/patterns/detail.html?pattern_id=271&series=2
